connector.description: Create a secret in AWS Secrets Manager.

camel.kamelet.aws-secrets-manager-sink.a.name: camel.kamelet.aws-secrets-manager-sink.accessKey
camel.kamelet.aws-secrets-manager-sink.a.description: The access key obtained from AWS.

camel.kamelet.aws-secrets-manager-sink.s.name: camel.kamelet.aws-secrets-manager-sink.secretKey
camel.kamelet.aws-secrets-manager-sink.s.description: The secret key obtained from AWS.

camel.kamelet.aws-secrets-manager-sink.u.name: camel.kamelet.aws-secrets-manager-sink.useDefaultCredentialsProvider
camel.kamelet.aws-secrets-manager-sink.u.description: Set whether the Secrets Manager client should expect to load credentials through a default credentials provider or to expect static credentials to be passed in.

camel.kamelet.aws-secrets-manager-sink.u.name: camel.kamelet.aws-secrets-manager-sink.useProfileCredentialsProvider
camel.kamelet.aws-secrets-manager-sink.u.description: Set whether the Secrets Manager client should expect to load credentials through a profile credentials provider.

camel.kamelet.aws-secrets-manager-sink.u.name: camel.kamelet.aws-secrets-manager-sink.useSessionCredentials
camel.kamelet.aws-secrets-manager-sink.u.description: Set whether the Secrets Manager client should expect to use Session Credentials. This is useful in situation in which the user needs to assume a IAM role for doing operations in Secrets Manager.

camel.kamelet.aws-secrets-manager-sink.p.name: camel.kamelet.aws-secrets-manager-sink.profileCredentialsName
camel.kamelet.aws-secrets-manager-sink.p.description: If using a profile credentials provider this parameter will set the profile name.

camel.kamelet.aws-secrets-manager-sink.s.name: camel.kamelet.aws-secrets-manager-sink.sessionToken
camel.kamelet.aws-secrets-manager-sink.s.description: Amazon AWS Session Token used when the user needs to assume a IAM role.
